info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued April 5 at 6:17PM EDT until April 6 at 12:15AM EDT by NWS Louisville KY
info.description:
FFWLMK
The National Weather Service in Louisville has issued a
* Flash Flood Warning for... Hardin County in central Kentucky... Hart County in central Kentucky... Larue County in central Kentucky...
* Until 1215 AM EDT /1115 PM CDT/.
* At 617 PM EDT /517 PM CDT/, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Addditional rainfall of 0.5 to 1 inch is expected in the next 45 minutes. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly.
HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding.
SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges.
IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses.
* Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Elizabethtown, Hodgenville, Munfordville, Radcliff, Vine Grove, Horse Cave, West Point, Upton, Sonora and Bonnieville.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

parameter.value: NWS: FLASH FLOOD WARNING this area til 12:15 AM EDT. Avoid flooded areas.

National Weather Service: A FLASH FLOOD WARNING is in effect for this area until 12:15 AM EDT. This is a dangerous and life-threatening situation. Do not attempt to travel unless you are fleeing an area subject to flooding or under an evacuation order.

area.areaDesc: Hardin, KY; Hart, KY; Larue, KY

parameter.value: SNM: AVISO DE INUNDACIONES REPENTINAS hasta 12:15 AM EDT. Evite areas inundadas.

Servicio Nacional de Meteorologia: AVISO DE INUNDACIONES REPENTINAS en efecto para esta area hasta las 12:15 AM EDT. Esta es una situacion peligrosa y amenaza la vida. No intente viajar a menos que sea para abandonar un area propensa a inundaciones o bajo una orden de desalojo.
